contents.description:
Include information on percentage of turnover that comes from online orders and where these orders originate from.

E-Commerce is the sale or purchase of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing of orders. The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.

contents.description: EDI messages allow the exchange of business documents between trading partners in a standard or structured machine-readable form. EDI is used to electronically transfer documents such as purchase orders, invoice or shipping bills. Businesses should  be able to process this data without having to manually record it (i.e. processing should be automated).

definitions.title: What are Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) type messages?

enquiries that did not result in receiving an order

contents.description: Include information on cloud computing services that your business uses over the internet.

options.label: Yes, we buy cloud computing services
options.value: Yes, we buy cloud computing services

options.label: No, we don't buy cloud computing services
options.value: No, we don't buy cloud computing services

contents.description: Cloud computing means services used over the internet, including connections via Virtual Private Networks - (VPN) to access software, computing power, storage capacity etc.
Characteristics of cloud computing services:
services are delivered from servers of service providers
services can be used as an on-demand self-service, at least after set up (without human interaction with a service provider)
services can be scaled up or down, for example for a change in number of users or storage capacity
services are paid by use or per capacity used, or they are prepaid

definitions.title: What is a cloud computing service?

contents.description: Big Data is the study of data sets that are generated from electronic activities and from machine-to-machine communications, for example, from social media or production processes. Big Data analysis refers to the use of techniques, technologies and software tools for analysing big data from your own business or other data sources.
Characteristics of Big Data:
vast amounts of data generated over time.
variety in terms of different formats of complex data, either structured or unstructured (for example text, video, images, voice, docs, sensor data, activity logs, click streams, coordinates).
velocity in terms of the high speed at which data are generated, become available and change over time.

contents.description: Include information on the use of industrial and service robots.

options.description: For example robotic welding, laser cutting and spray painting
options.label: Yes, we use industrial robots
options.value: Yes, we use industrial robots

options.label: No, we do not use industrial robots
options.value: No, we do not use industrial robots

contents.description: An industrial robot is an automatically controlled, reprogrammable, multipurpose manipulator programmable in three or more axes, which may be either fixed in place or mobile for use. Most existing industrial robots are based on the robot arm with a solid base and a series of links and joints with an end effector that carries out the task.
Exclude service robots (with a degree of autonomy)

title.text: Does {company_name} use industrial robots?

options.description: For example robots for surveillance, robots for cleaning, or robots for transportation.
options.label: Yes, we use service robots
options.value: Yes, we use service robots

options.label: No, we do not use service robots
options.value: No, we do not use service robots

contents.description: A service robot is a machine that has a degree of autonomy that enables it to operate in complex and dynamic environments, and may require interaction with persons, objects or other devices. They are designed to fit their tasks, working in the air (e.g. as a drone), under water, or on land, using wheels or legs to achieve mobility with arms and end effectors to physically interact and are often used in inspection and maintenance tasks.
Exclude industrial robots (used for automation applications)

title.text: Does {company_name} use service robots?

values: Yes, we use service robots

options.description: For example, the use of autonomous airborne drones

options.value: Construction works or damage repair tasks

They are designed to fit their tasks, working in the air (e.g. as a drone), under water, or on land, using wheels or legs to achieve mobility with arms and end effectors to physically interact and are often used in inspection and maintenance tasks.
Exclude industrial robots  (used for automation applications)
